title: 110_s1368
content: The "Denali Commission Act Amendments Act of 2007" is the short title of this Act. It outlines the authorities and duties of the Denali Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, the acceptance of matching funds for projects, and adjustments to Commission personnel matters. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to include limitations on Commission members' federal employee status, acceptance of matching funds for projects, and adjustments to Commission personnel matters. The amendments specify exceptions for compensation, rate of pay, and appointment of personnel for the Commission. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Commission to terminate appointed personnel and adjust the Economic Development Committee's responsibilities. The Denali Commission has special functions outlined in Section 3. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The program focuses on construction, operations, maintenance, and management training for Commission projects, as well as initiatives for Alaskan youths. Amounts made available for the program remain accessible until used. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize a training program for careers in infrastructure development in rural Alaska. The program focuses on construction, operations, maintenance, and management training for Commission projects, as well as initiatives for Alaskan youths. Amounts made available for the program remain accessible until used. Additionally, the Commission is required to provide assistance for teacher housing needs in rural Alaska, including activities such as housing development, rehabilitation, and new construction. The Denali Commission Act of 1998 is amended to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2009 through 2014. The effective date for the amendments is the date of enactment of the Act, with the authorization of appropriations taking effect on October 1, 2008.
